title: Cross-Domain Reasoning via Template Filling
abstract: In this paper, we explore the ability of sequence to sequence models to perform crossdomain reasoning. Towards this, we present a prompt-template-filling approach to enable sequence to sequence models to perform crossdomain reasoning. We also present a casestudy with commonsense and health and wellbeing domains, where we study how prompttemplate-filling enables pretrained sequence to sequence models across domains. Our experiments across several pretrained encoderdecoder models show that cross-domain reasoning is challenging for current models. We also show an in-depth error analysis and avenues for future research for reasoning across domains1.
